Key Match Events: Victor Wembanyama made 6 of 12 attempts from three, including 4 of 5 in the first half.
De' Aaron Fox, Domantas Sabonis, and DeMar DeRozan collectively scored 68 points in the first half.
The Kings only had two players (De' Aaron Fox and Trey Lyles) who made two three-pointers or more.
The Spurs made 22 of 46 (47.8%) of their three-point attempts, tying a franchise record.
The Kings shot just 10 of 38 from distance (26.3%).
The Spurs had 7 turnovers in the 1st quarter alone, leading to 12 Kings points.
Pre-Game Insights: The shooting woes continued for the Sacramento Kings.
DeMar DeRozan was brought in to improve the Kings' outside shooting, but he currently leads the team in 3P% at 40%.
Kevin Huerter, Keon Ellis, Keegan Murray, De' Aaron Fox, Malik Monk, and Doug McDermott are all struggling with their outside shooting.
Post-Match Reflections: Chris Paul brought stability to the Spurs with timely passes for open points.
Victor Wembanyama showcased off his skills as a shooter, walking into several 30-foot three-pointers from the top of the key.
Victor Wembanyama finished with a game-high 34 points, 14 rebounds, 6 assists, and 3 blocks in just 34 minutes.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings' Big Three of De' Aaron Fox, Domantas Sabonis, and DeMar DeRozan all did well, but they got almost no help from the supporting cast.
The Spurs' seven players finished in double digits, including every starter.
Others: The Kings had an opportunity to tie or take the lead going into halftime but Keegan Murray rushed the outlet pass and hit Sabonis square in the back as the ball bounced out of bounds.
The Spurs started the third quarter on a 10-0 run as Sacramento failed to score again until De' Aaron Fox made some free throws at the 5:15 mark.
